main event: A bright pulsating white light was observed changing altitude and direction over Pueblo, Colorado, on January 6, 1952.
interesting points: The light was noted to be a solid object rather than a celestial phenomenon., The observation lasted for about 7-8 minutes without any sound., A later interview with witnesses confirmed they were credible and saw objects with a swishing sound., Three observers reported seeing the objects, which were saucer-shaped and silver in color., The objects were estimated to be about 100 feet in diameter and moved at a high rate of speed.
witness description: The observers described the objects' shape, color, size, and movement indicating they believed it to be under intelligent control.
